scenarioDescription:
The TOI-125 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-125 is a star with 0.86 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 362.23 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-125 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-125 system


TOI-125 b

TOI-125 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-125 b is 9.505 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-125 b is 2.726 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-125 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


TOI-125 c

TOI-125 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-125 c is 6.633 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-125 c is 2.759 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-125 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


TOI-125 d

TOI-125 d was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-125 d is 13.607 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-125 d is 2.930 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-125 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-125, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-125 - System With 3 Exolanets
